Your name in the Credits
Terrors and Tommyguns Bookmarked PDF
Terrors and Tommyguns Hardcover signed and personalized by the developers

support.title: Retailer Pledge Level
support.descp:
Your name in the Credits
Terrors and Tommyguns Bookmarked PDF
Four Terrors and Tommyguns Hardcover Corebooks
All unlocked Stretch Goals *
*You must be able to prove that you are a brick and mortar games store before this pledge will be fulfilled.

support.title: Whole Table Bundle!
support.descp:
Your name in the Credits
Terrors and Tommyguns Bookmarked PDF
4 copies of the Terrors and Tommyguns Hardcover (savings of $40!)
All Applicable Stretch Goals

support.title: Custom Adventure written and run for you
support.descp:
For the truly discerning member of the Collective. Along with a signed, personalized physical copy of the Corebook, PDF, AND stretch goals we will, with your guidance and direction as to what you'd like, create a custom adventure for you and your gaming group. The Drinking Horn Games crew will then run it via Zoom for you and your gaming group!
*Please note that the book will be sent out with everyone else's. The custom adventure will be done after the book is finished and delivered.

support.title: Become Immortal
support.descp:
Your name in the Credits as an Immortal Backer
Terrors and Tommyguns Bookmarked PDF
Terrors and Tommyguns Hardcover
All unlocked Stretch Goals
Work with the Drinking Horn Games crew to design a custom NPC (with portrait by our art team) that will appear as a major player (and playable foe) within New Babylon.

support.title: Virtual High-Five
support.descp: Want to lend your support but you don't want anything in return? We won't say no! Every little bit counts. Send us a buck and you'll have our sincere gratitude.

support.title: Cult Postcard Dispatches
support.descp:
Get intriguing and educational cult postcards in the mail! During the production of American Cult, we will send out at least four postcards featuring art by American Cult authors. (Only available in the USA. Free shipping. Please update your address if you move!)
INCLUDES:
Cult Postcard Dispatches

support.title: American Cult, the PDF!
support.descp:
Get the digital version of American Cult!
INCLUDES:
American Cult (digital edition)

support.title: American Cult, the book!
support.descp:
Get the print edition of American Cult! Free shipping within the USA.
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)

support.title: Ellen Lindner Author Bundle
support.descp:
Ellen Lindner's contribution to American Cult is about Fruitlands, a short-lived and ill-conceived utopian community founded in 1843. In this bundle you'll get American Cult (both digital and print editions) and the cult postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book). You'll also get two issues of The Cranklet's Chronicle, Ellen's zine about women in baseball (for more info, go to etsy.com/shop/littlewhitebird).
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
The Cranklet's Chronicle Issue 1
The Cranklet's Chronicle Issue 2

support.title: Robyn Chapman Author Bundle
support.descp:
Editor Robyn Chapman's contribution to American Cult is about Heaven's Gate, a UFO cult whose members died in a mass suicide. In this bundle you'll get American Cult (both digital and print editions), the cult postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book), and a Risograph reproduction of Heaven's Gate recruitment flyer. You'll also get Twin Bed, Robyn's handcrafted comic/artist book (for more info go to thetinyreport.storenvy.com).
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
Twin Bed by Robyn Chapman
Heaven's Gate Flyer Reproduction

support.title: Jesse Lambert Author Bundle
support.descp:
Jesse Lambert's contribution to American Cult is about his own experience growing up in what he calls a "communist psychotherapy cult." Jesse is a renowned fine artist and we are honored to be turning his illustration "Lost and Found" into a limited edition two-color screen print. This bundle also includes American Cult (both digital and print editions), the cult postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book), and The Underground, a minicomic by Jesse based on a childhood dream about systematic oppression and radical politics.
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
"Lost and Found" Screen Print by Jesse Lambert
The Underground by Jesse Lambert

support.title: J.T. Yost Author Bundle
support.descp:
J.T. Yost's contribution to American Cult is a 22-page story about life inside the Westboro Baptist Church. In this bundle you'll get American Cult (both digital and print editions), the cult postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book), and a mini-poster featuring J.T.'s illustration of Dorothy Martin, failed doomsday prophet. You'll also get two themed anthologies that J.T. edited and published: Bottoms Up and Cringe (for more info go to birdcage-bottom-books.myshopify.com).
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
Bottoms Up: True Tales of Hitting Rock-Bottom
Cringe: An Anthology of Embarrassment
Dorothy Martin Mini-Poster

support.title: American Cult Retailer Package
support.descp:
AVAILABLE TO BOOK RETAILERS ONLY. Get five copies of American Cult at the wholesale price. Free shipping in the USA.
INCLUDES:
5× American Cult (print edition)

support.title: American Cult Bonus Bundle
support.descp:
In this bundle you'll get a digital and print edition of American Cult plus a bunch of goodies: the cult postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book), the Jesse Lambert screen print, and a Risograph reproduction of Heaven's Gate recruitment flyer.
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
"Lost and Found" Screen Print by Jesse Lambert
Cult Postcard Dispatches
Heaven's Gate Flyer Reproduction

support.title: Box Brown Author Bundle
support.descp:
Box Brown's contribution to American Cult is about a group currently in the headlines: NXIVM, a notorious self-improvement group that many have labeled a "sex cult." In the Box Brown Bundle you'll get American Cult (both digital and print editions), the cult postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book), and three comics by Box: Powerman, Number 1, and An Entity Observes All Things (for more information visit kilgorebooks.com and retrofit.storenvy.com). You'll also get your choice of one enamel pin designed by Box, either a cannabis bud or Andre the Giant.
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
Powerman by Box Brown
Number 1 by Box Brown
An Entity Observes All Things by Box Brown
Box Brown Enamel Pin

support.title: Ben Passmore Author Bundle
support.descp:
Ben Passmore's contribution to American Cult is about MOVE, a Philadelphia-based black liberation group whose headquarters were bombed by the police, killing nearly everyone inside. In this bundle you'll get American Cult (both digital and print editions), the cult postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book), and a MOVE Risograph print illustrated by Ben. Also included is Ben's book Your Black Friend and Other Strangers and his All Cats are Beautiful patch (for more info go to store.silversprocket.net).
INCLUDES:
American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
Your Black Friend and Other Strangers by Ben Passmore
MOVE Risograph print
All Cats Are Beautiful Patch

support.title: American Cult Patron Package
support.descp:
In this special package, you'll get a digital edition and TWO print editions of American Cult (give one to a friend!), the postcard dispatches (for international orders, the postcard set will arrive with the book), The Underground minicomic, and all the prints: the screen print by Jesse Lambert, the MOVE Risograph print by Ben Passmore, the Dorothy Martin mini-poster by J.T. Yost, and the Heaven's Gate flyer Risograph reproduction. AND you'll be thanked by name in the back of the book. Free shipping within the USA.
INCLUDES:
2× American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
"Lost and Found" Screen Print by Jesse Lambert
MOVE Risograph Print by Ben Passmore
Heaven's Gate Flyer Reproduction
Dorothy Martin Mini-Poster
The Underground by Jesse Lambert

support.title: American Cult Retailer Bonus Package
support.descp:
AVAILABLE TO BOOK RETAILERS ONLY. Get seven copies of American Cult at the wholesale price. You'll also get three copies each of these comics from Paper Rocket, Robyn Chapman's micro-press: Limp Wrist, Dear Missy, Carlito, and Texas Chainsaw Sculptor. (These are some of Paper Rocket's most popular titles, and together retail for $66. See thetinyreport.storenvy.com for more info.) PLUS your store will be thanked in the back of the book. Free shipping within the USA.
INCLUDES:
7× American Cult (print edition)
3× Limp Wrist by Scout Wolfcave and Penina Gal
3× Dear Missy by Daryl Seitchik
3× Carlito by Carlo Quispe
3× Texas Chainsaw Sculptor by Katie Fricas

support.title: American Cult Super Patron Package
support.descp:
One lucky (and generous) patron will get everything that comes in the Patron Package, PLUS original art by J.T. Yost! This reward includes J.T.'s beautifully inked illustration of failed doomsday prophet Dorothy Martin.
INCLUDES:
2× American Cult (print edition)
American Cult (digital edition)
Cult Postcard Dispatches
"Lost and Found" Screen Print by Jesse Lambert
MOVE Risograph Print by Ben Passmore
Heaven's Gate Flyer Reproduction
Dorothy Martin Mini-Poster
The Underground by Jesse Lambert
Original art by J.T. Yost

Do you have a grouping of favorite flowers, or perhaps a special bouquet you would like to keep ‘forever blooming’ in paint? Sarah will paint them for you. You will receive the original artwork via the post.
Shipping will be charged after the campaign ($15+). See FAQ for the shipping chart.
INCLUDES:
Custom Flower Bouquet Commission
Original Painting

support.title: Choose Your own Adventure
support.descp:
Work with Sarah to create a special art piece, original and made to your request. Your colors, your subject.
Shipping will be charged after the campaign ($15+). See FAQ for the shipping chart.
INCLUDES:
Choose Your own Adventure
Original Painting

support.title: HEY I'M IN THE BOOK
support.descp: To help show our thanks, the names of ALL of our Kickstarter backers will be included in the book (subject to approval, natch). Your support means so much to us!

support.title: Digital Corebook
support.descp:
All Lower Tier Rewards and...
You will receive a Digital Edition of the Sagas of Midgard Corebook.

support.title: Digital Corebook PLUS Digital Rune Deck
support.descp:
Your name in the Corebook, a Digital Edition of the Sagas of Midgard Corebook as well as digital prints of the Rune Deck.
The Rune deck includes all 24 Runes in the game with custom calligraphy by Jennifer Baugh, the rune name, and all three positions of the Rune with a Sagas of Midgard Logo on the back. Great for pulling random runes and casting at the table!

support.title: Signed Hardcover Corebook
support.descp:
All Lower Tier Rewards and...
You will receive a printed edition of the Sagas of Midgard corebook signed by the creative team.
Shipping extra.

support.title: Signed Physical Corebook PLUS Rune Deck
support.descp:
All lower tier rewards (Name in Credits, Digital Edition, Signed Physical Edition) as well as a physical version of the rune-deck.
The Rune deck includes all 24 Runes in the game with custom calligraphy by Jennifer Baugh, the rune name, and all three positions of the Rune with a Sagas of Midgard Logo on the back. Great for pulling random runes and casting at the table!
Additional Rune-Decks may be added with an additional pledge of $15.

support.title: Hardcover Corebook and Art Print
support.descp:
Your Name in the Credits
Digital Corebook
Signed Physical Corebook
You will also receive a signed, high quality print of an original Sagas of Midgard painting by Leah Porter. Choose from:
"Son of the Deceiver"
"Night Sky"
"That Windswept Tree"
"Ravens"
"Shadows of Bifrost"
Prints will be anywhere from 10x10 to 16x20 depending on the picture and its original proportions. Additional art prints can be added for an additional $30.

support.title: Physical Corebook, Art Print, Rune Deck
support.descp:
Your Name in the Credits
Digital Corebook
Signed Physical Corebook
You will also receive a signed, high quality print of an original Sagas of Midgard painting by Leah Porter. Choose from:
"Son of the Deceiver"
"Night Sky"
"That Windswept Tree"
"Ravens"
"Shadows of Bifrost"
Prints will be anywhere from 10x10 to 16x20 depending on the picture and its original proportions. Additional art prints can be added for an additional $30. Additional Rune Decks can be added for an additional $15.

support.title: Retailer Pledge!
support.descp:
We're honored that you want to have the Kickstarter edition of our book (with premium color!) in your store.
Receive FOUR Sagas of Midgard Physical Corebooks, as well as your store's name in the Kickstarter Backer Credits*.
*You must provide proof that you are, in fact, a brick and mortar games store in the Continental US or your pledge will NOT be honored. Contact us BEFORE PLEDGING if you have any doubts about your ability to do so.

support.title: FULL TABLE BUNDLE
support.descp: Get your whole group set up to game with three copies of the Physical Corebook, and three copies of the Rune-deck (enough to ensure even your finest runesmiths don't run out!)

support.title: Get In The Game, Drengr!
support.descp:
Receive:
Your Name in the Credits
Digital Rune-Deck
Digital Edition
Physical Edition
Physical Rune-Deck
PLUS you can leave your mark on the world of Midgard by adding a location AND prominent character (subject to approval) into the Corebook.

support.title: Begin Your Saga in Style
support.descp:
Your Name in the Credits
Digital Edition
Physical Edition
Physical Rune-Deck
PLUS
We will hand deliver these items to you when we run an adventure custom-written for you! Get your group together (or play with the development team) and let's game**!
**We will meet you at any public place within 20 mi of the center of Atlanta. If you can't make it, we will ship your items to you at no additional cost.**

This amazingly detailed miniature will be suitable for painting, but will look plenty spiffy in its natural pewter state. It’s a tiny treasure worth hoarding… but you could give it as the best gift ever to a dragon loving friend. support.title: Personalized/Published Dragon Art
support.descp:
Do you love dragons? Do you want to give a remarkable gift to your dragon-loving self (or to someone you love who loves dragons)? Do not pass up this opportunity to have Brian Kesinger create original dragon art based on your request... and then have that art published in all editions of the "Penned Dragons" book. Seriously, this is a remarkable opportunity to play a part in the creation of the best book ever about the best creatures ever! If mermaids offered you this same opportunity, you would laugh at them. But, DRAGONS... c'mon, what are you waiting for?
Personalized Art Guidelines:
Your art request can feature one dragon and a specific theme. Brian has the right to refuse the concept, so please be thoughtful with your request. Finished art will be approximately 9 X 9 inches. Ownership of the original art does not include reproduction/publication rights.
INCLUDES:

updates.update_content:
Interested in what's going on in the land of Baby Tattoo? Join Brian Kesinger and Ringmaster Bob for a live, interactive "Ask Us Anything" video chat via Zoom at 6:00 PM Pacific Time on Thursday, August 27th, 2020. We'll be discussing the status of the 'Time Traveling With Your Octopus' book, what the book production process is like, and anything else you might have on your mind. 
Zoom Meeting ID (click to join): 818 7487 6039

updates.update_userinfo: Return to "Dragons vs. Mermaids Surprise Rematch"
updates.update_content:
Hopefully this will be the conclusory update in what will likely become known as the Time Traveling Octopus Meets Dragons vs. Mermaids trilogy. 
Yesterday's premature Robots vs. Witches campaign has been sent back to the future (where it belongs), causing the equally mis-timestamped Dragons vs. Mermaids campaign to boomerang back into existence from its day-before-yesterday prominence. One more day should see it back in the past (where it belongs).
But while the ghosts of dragons and mermaids past have been haunting the Time Traveling Octopus campaign for a few hours, they've generously added a bonus reward to Levels 3 and 4. Either a Dragons vs. Mermaids or an Otto & Victoria bookmark will be selected at random and included in each of these trilogy book set bundles. You can read all about it in the most recent .

Remember how yesterday a girl and her pet cephalopod broke Kickstarter and caused Baby Tattoo and Brian Kesinger's current Time Traveling Octopus campaign to be semi-co-opted into a vague variant of the 2017 Dragons vs. Mermaids campaign?
Surprise...
Today that same project has apparently fast forwarded to 2020 and become a sequel titled [Robots vs. Witches] vs. [Dragons vs. Mermaids]. For real (for the moment)! Check out whatever this next-iteration mixed-and-matched mishmash project is by clicking .

Remember when Baby Tattoo and Brian Kesinger launched a Kickstarter campaign for a dragon sketchbook? Remember how a bunch of renegade dragons hacked the campaign? Remember how some angry mermaids staged a hostile takeover? Remember how it all turned out to be a P.R. stunt?
If you thought things couldn't get any stranger, have we got an update for you!
Stop us if you've heard this one before... A time traveling Victorian woman-about-town and her pet land octopus have broken Kickstarter and caused Baby Tattoo and Brian Kesinger's current campaign to transform into a chronologically corrupted  campaign which has now undergone some sort of intra-Kickstarter backslide to degenerate into an imperfect clone of the 2017 campaign!

Greetings, Baby Tattoo enthusiasts!
We'd like to let you know about a project by Mac Beauvais, a close ally of Brian Kesinger's and longtime Victoria cosplayer.

Ringmaster Bob here with a quick update to let everyone know we’ve just launched two new book campaigns!
One, “When Is High Moon?” is a graphic novel anthology created by moonlighting artists from the story and visual development departments at Walt Disney Animation Studios. Featuring work by John Musker, Brian Kesinger, Brittney Lee, and more, this passion project reflects on the question "When Is High Moon?".

campaign.story:
This is a super simple, short-run project to create 100 Ruth Bader Ginsburg enamel pin portraits.
These 1.5" pins will be made out of shiny black nickle and soft enamel due to the amount of detail in the design and the fact that they will have white glitter for her notorious pearl collar.  
Here's the mock-up for the finished pin + backer card:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my fifth(?) Kickstarter and the BIGGEST challenge I have is getting the word out.

I can't make the goal if nobody knows this project exists and if nobody pledges. This is a challenge that YOU, the backer can have a lot of impact on. If you love it, share it. If you hate it, also share it, because maybe someone you know will love it :)

I don't foresee any major challenges, it's a pretty straight forward project without too many moving pieces. I've calculated the timing, production, and shipping costs and added a little bit extra of everything just in the case something does come up.

I'm going to continue working with the amazing manufacturer that I found a couple projects back, so no worries there.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Update - Tungsten has arrived!
Element Block Set - Show with optional Tungsten Block (W)
You guys asked and we've delivered! In return for the campaign reaching $50,000 in funding we've added an optional Tungsten block (Symbol: W) that will be available in our post campaign survey for purchase as an add-on. The upgrade will also include upgrading the 4-piece set to a 5-piece set. Images of the regular set ($38) shown below.
Pledge Levels
----------
Element Blocks are a real taste of the periodic table right on your desk! 
Iron, Copper, Aluminum, Titanium
For a long time, we've wanted a small sample of these common elements on our desk to remind us of how different these materials really are. Well, we've made them, so you can have them too!
Each of these elements really do feel totally different from one another.
Iron - It's density immediately makes it feel super heavy compared to say, aluminum or titanium. This material alloyed with a little bit of carbon, makes steel which is nearly twice as strong as aluminum.
Copper - Slightly more dense than iron, yet almost twice as weak. This material shines in it's thermal and electrical conductivity.
Aluminum - Lightweight, yet strong. This material is extremely popular for applications where lightweight strength is needed.
Titanium - The most 'exotic' of the bunch. This material is often used in lightweight applications where aluminum just isn't strong enough.
Copper has over twice the density of aluminum
Quality:
Each cube and the stand is made from high purity billet, machined on a CNC mill with extreme precision. After machining, the cubes are then polished prior to being laser engraved. 
How large are the cubes?Each Cube is approximately 1" x 1" x 1". 
Calipers Measuring the Cubes
How pure are the cubes?
All the cubes are greater than or approximately equal to 90% purity. 
"Fe" is low-carbon steel (~96% pure Iron). 
"Al" is 6061 aerospace grade aluminum (96-98% pure aluminum). 
"Ti" is aerospace grade Ti-6-4 titanium (~90% titanium).
 "Cu" is C110 (~99% copper).
Don't iron and copper oxidize/patina/rust?
All metals oxidize under certain conditions, but you can easily prevent this from taking place. That said, the copper and iron will form a beautiful patina over time if you allow it to take place. The iron cube is technically low-carbon steel (~96% Iron) so if you would like to keep a patina from happening, be sure to regularly apply a very thin layer of oil to the "Fe" cube. As for the copper cube, a patina can be kept from forming by cleaning with vinegar, lemon juice, or alcohol.
Will you deliver on time and as promised?
We take our reputation very seriously and we always aim to deliver a high quality product in a timely manner. Check out our previous campaign for the Cable Carousels if you'd like to read the comments of previous backers. 

Check out some of the awesome comments our previous campaign had
Great Feedback from Previous Backers
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The largest challenge will be maintaining consistent quality throughout the production phase of this project. We have plenty of experience handling the phenomenon known as "quality fade". To combat this, production runs from our suppliers will be handled in batches so quality expectations can be met.

Additionally, we will be personally inspecting each set of Element Blocks prior to shipment. 

We'll do everything in our power to insure only the finest products end up in your hands.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
We just finished packing up every. single. order. We're hoping they will all fit on the mail truck tomorrow. If not - we'll be loading up our personal truck to drop off all these orders at the post office.  We loved doing this, but we are super excited to get our garage back.

Hello Backers,
About 40% of pledges have now been completely shipped and are in the hands of the postal service. Please allow your tracking numbers some time to update. 
Please email us directly contactus@minimael.com with any issues about your order. Questions about your particular order in the general comments section may not be answered.

updates.update_userinfo: Update your Addresses! Last Update Prior to Shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,  
As you might have already read, I took a trip last week to visit our supplier. Please see the video below.

Hello Everyone,
Packaging
We got our final packaging sample early last week and are pleased with the outcome, we think they look great but would love to hear your thoughts. Fancy packaging was never part of the plan. However, since so many of you are presenting the Element Blocks as gifts, we're glad we found a way you can present them with pride.

Hello Backers,
We've had a really busy past few weeks dealing with a few production issues. But don't worry we're still tracking for our Mid/Late July ship date.
Last week our supplier received a bad batch of copper and titanium and this offset the production of those cubes by 1 week and delayed our trip over to them by 2 weeks (We're now visiting end of June)

campaign.story:
Hey! As the campaign winds down, you should definitely check out the stretch goals!
- - -
 My name is Ngozi and I'm the creator of Check, Please!, an online comic about hockey, college, and the frequent baking of pies. Since the summer of 2013, Check, Please! has updated about every other month with complete, fully-illustrated episodes. I successfully Kickstarted Year One and now I’m back to print Year Two and reprint Year One!
Check, Please! follows Eric “Bitty” Bittle, a former Georgia junior figure skating champion, vlogger extraordinaire, and master baker who gets a scholarship playing hockey at Samwell University. Not only is Bitty bite-sized for a hockey player, he is not at all a bro and has one great fear: getting checked—or hit—while on the ice.
The first volume of Check, Please follows Bitty’s freshman year. Over the course of the school year at Samwell, Bitty manages to befriend his bro-y teammates and find a home, all while dealing with the brooding Jack Zimmermann, captain of the Samwell men’s hockey team and former hockey prodigy.  
Bitty’s sophomore year is the the volume we’re Kickstarting! From moving into the Samwell Hockey Haus at the beginning of the year, to saying goodbye to seniors at graduation, Bitty's life changes a ton during his second year at Samwell.
And you can read all about it here!
The goal of this project is to collect the comics from the second volume of Check, Please!—aka, Bitty’s sophomore year—into a full-color printed book. Not only will the finished book compile the main comics, it will also include extra features such as concept pages and a wealth of author notes—all of which are book exclusive! I’ll also be reprinting Year One which is currently sold out.
The last campaign was incredible. It was the largest project I have ever undertaken and I learned a lot from it. I want to make sure that there are as few complications and delays as possible this time around.
Another change for this campaign is that instead of signing books themselves I'll be signing sticker bookplates for any physical editions. For the Year One kickstarter, I had to fly to Austin, TX and sign books for two days straight--this slowed down the shipping process immensely. By doing signed bookplates that are included with your physical copy, you can apply the bookplate yourself or tuck it inside if you prefer!
        ☆THE BOOKS - You can get Year Two and Year One in digital, softcover, or hardcover formats! Both books come with author notes and extras not seen on the web. You can even get physical editions that come with signed bookplates! 
☆ PRINT SETS - A set of FOUR (4) Year Two themed postcard sized (4x6”) prints. The images above are examples, the final prints will be different.
☆ BITTY'S SAMWELL JERSEY - That's right, you can own Bitty's Samwell jersey! I'll be working extensively with a real apparel company to create number 15's white Samwell sweater!
★ ARTIST BOOKPLATE - Custom bookplates are bookplates that I design, print, illustrate on, and glue into a book with PVA bookbinding glue. This is as custom as it gets!
★ DIGITAL COMMISSIONS - A high-res, full-color PG-Rated digital illustration of up to two Check, Please characters with a simple background. Please have your commission idea ready. I'll shoot you a message during the campaign for approval. If I'm not comfortable with the content or rating, you'll be able to lower or cancel your pledge before being charged. Thanks you!
★ BE-A-WELLIE!  - Get drawn into the comic as a background character at Samwell University and become part of the Check, Please universe! You send me a photo and I'll send you a message before the comic update in which you appear!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Outside of extras, the pages for the books are done, a printer has been locked down, and I've got a designer and production person ready to help me work on the files. I'm working with the same fulfillment center, Amplifier, to ship rewards, and even have some help from the folks at Breadpig to make sure things get managed and seen through to completion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hello there! Grab a seat, class is back in session.
Page-a-day calendars. The 2017 version!
nearly entirely different from the previous calendar!
Let's start at the beginning.
I'm Dr. Dante Shepherd. For the past eight years, I've been producing Surviving The World, a daily photocomic with a chalkboard and labcoat and lessons touching on just about everything (science, literature, creeping people out, you name it). The comic is a mix of humor and education combined with complete destruction of the fourth wall. In my real life, I'm an actual professor, and in STW, I pretend to be.  And the comic is a whole lot funnier!
One of over 2800 STW comics
Page-a-day calendars?
We previously made a page-a-day calendars for 2014 through a Kickstarter, and they came out friggin' amazing.  6.25 inches by 6.25 inches, weighty, full color, utterly beautiful.
The 2014 ones came out friggin' amazing. So let's make new ones for 2017! With new content!
You could plaster your door or your fridge with them.  You could plaster your dog with them.  The stand-alone content worked perfectly as a page-a-day calendar, and given that there are now over 2800 comics to choose from, you'll get a solid 365 days of content!
Not only that, but these calendars will contain 50 ORIGINAL STW COMICS!  That's on top of pulling from the best of the previous 2800+ comics!
Look at these beautiful pages! Let's do it again!
And each page has other content to enjoy!  Besides a comic on each page you get:
- a fake international holiday inspired by a real historical event for every single day of the year!
- a rudimentary word-of-the-day, basically making your calendar two-calendars-in-one, but in this case, we reaffirm the quality of your present vocabulary!  Who needs to learn new words when you're already good at words!
- a cloud name for each day of the year! Hurricane centers tell you what hurricanes are called and some weather channels tell you what winter storms are called, but this calendar goes even further and unilaterally tells you what the clouds themselves are named!
What else?
To thank you for your contribution to the campaign, there are number of pretty cool rewards available at the different tiers, many of which will only be available through this Kickstarter. These rewards may even increase your happiness, which, hey, who doesn't want that?  
What are some of these great rewards?
Well, let's talk about them!
Recognition on the Surviving the World site itself! (And you'll even get a nickname of questionable coolness!)
A PDF form of the 2017 calendar!
A hard copy of the 2017 calendar!
A leftover hard copy of the 2014 calendar! 
Magnets depicting classic STW mazes to help hang up the pages of the calendar that you display!
Maze for Magnet #1
The STW class report card printed on a whiteboard, for your own personal life assessment!
Initial report card design!
A STW-specialized black dry-erase board!
A personalized mini-slate chalkboard with a permanent lesson, personalized for whatever subject matter you want!
Someone last time requested their slate lesson be about "potatoes"
An original maze painting on canvas, with colors of your choosing!
I will even once again eat a pound of raisins (and hate every second of it and be utterly miserable in more ways than one that day), just like last time!
There are even crazy tier levels, like getting a ball of cat hair with your rewards, or having me draw a mustache on my face on every page!
And may reward tiers include various combinations of these rewards!
Anything else? 
Actually, yes! There are a number of STW items which you can directly choose to include as a reward if you add it on to your backing tier. These can include additional calendars as well. First, select the reward tier that you're interested in, with the amount necessary to support the campaign at that tier. Then, make your donation an additional amount to reflect the add-on item that you wanted. This will cover the shipping of both items, too.
The pricing for the add-on items are as follows:  
An extra calendar = $25
A set of 4 black-and-white STW mini-books containing lessons from the site, signed and personalized = $10
A set of 12 STW squid-themed Christmas cards = $12
A velociraptor USB containing over nearly 50 different velociraptor impressions = $15
An official STW labcoat = $40
A signed official STW labcoat = $45
Stretch goals?
If we're fortunate enough to hit the target and keep on going from there, we will not only continue to improve the content of the calendar itself but also improve the content of the rewards that you receive!  So consider, if we break the following overall tiers:
$27,500 – FLURRY OF CHALKDUST: the calendar will contain 12 new STW comics - ON TOP OF THE 50 ORIGINAL COMICS already part of the calendar!  So a total of 62 ORIGINAL COMICS!
$30,000 – THE AUDIOBOOK: a digital recording of me reading the entire calendar will be provided to all backers
$35,000 – THE SOUNDTRACK: a soundtrack listing to go with every calendar page will be provided to all backers
$40,000 – REFRIGERATOR EXTRAVAGANZA: two additional magnets to the magnet set for every A-PLUS and higher level
$45,000 - TO BE ANNOUNCED as we get closer 
So fingers crossed!
All of this and all of that sounds awesome!
I agree!  So thank you for your support!  You will love these calendars!
Thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The calendar design is complete, and most of the content is already prepared. In order to handle distribution, I'm working with Topatoco and Make That Thing once again to help get the highest quality of product and to make sure the calendars get out to everyone on time! So there shouldn't be too many concerns moving forward! Onwards!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello all!
So here's the good news on STW Calendars!
I am still planning on making the digital version of the STW calendars!  These would be released both as daily update delivered directly to you, and as a collected PDF.
To be able to do this, I have set some goals through Patreon!  And as long as you pledge at $1/month, you will be able to receive the calendar content and at a cheaper rate than you would have gotten through the Kickstarter!

Well, we've got about 12 hours to go and we're sitting at 47% funded.  That means unless there's a dramatic swarm of people suddenly backing at the last second (unlikely) or a insanely wealthy person with money burning a hole in a pocket (also probably unlikely), we will not meet our goal.
It would certainly be disappointing, at the very least, and we would certainly not be able to make physical copies of the 2017 calendar.  However, it would still be possible to make a digital version and make that available - and given that we would not be restricted by the enormous printing and shipping costs that made our goal so high, we would be able to make the entire calendar far cheaper for you to enjoy and use.

campaign.story:
Hi Kickstarter!
Four years ago, we joined this amazing community and you helped bring Litographs to life, as we launched our first collection of literary t-shirts.

Since then we've expanded our collection of t-shirts, posters and totes to feature the work of nearly 200 classic and contemporary authors. And in 2014, over six thousand of you helped us create the world's longest literary tattoo chain and launch our line of temporary literary tattoos.
This year we're back to ask for your support to help launch our new product line for 2016... Now you can wear your favorite author's words on infinity scarves!
To celebrate the launch of our scarves, for the first time ever, we're producing entirely custom Litographs, exclusive to Kickstarter. We've always wanted to print your words, and now each and every backer will be able to wear their own unique text.
Whether you would love to see your own writing in print (maybe you have a short story or write poetry), wear the words of a loved one or friend (perhaps your other half writes song lyrics), or pick any other piece of text in the public domain (a classic novel from before 1923, a famous historical speech, or even the first 40,000 digits of pi) – we will handcraft you a truly one-of-a-kind scarf or t-shirt. You can even customize the color, style and size of your text.

We can't wait to see what you'll come up with!
– Danny, Founder at Litographs
When the Kickstarter ends, we'll send you a survey to choose your product type, customize your font and color, and upload your own custom piece of text. You can also pick one of the nearly 200 classic or contemporary books in our collection (explore our list of available books here – including Pride and Prejudice, Outlander, Sherlock Holmes, Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland, Hamlet, and many more).
Depending on the font size and style you choose, you can fit between 2,000 and 40,000 words on your scarf or t-shirt. For instance, 40,000 words is about the length of a short novel. However, it doesn't matter how long or how short your text is – we can use an extract, or repeat your words across whichever product you choose.
If you fancy getting yourself (or a friend or loved one) a truly one-of-a-kind Litographs scarf or t-shirt, below you'll find some fun ideas we've come up with as inspiration if you're choosing the custom text option. As long as it's your own writing, you have permission to use it, or it's in the public domain – your imagination is the only limit!
Just like our t-shirts, our new infinity scarves will be hand-pressed to order in Cambridge, MA. We use high-quality, 100% spun polyester to deliver the look and feel of cotton, while allowing for full color, all-over dye sublimation printing – your text will cover every inch! Dye sublimation printing produces vibrant, super soft, permanent prints that are guaranteed to never shrink or fade when machine washed.
Every Litographs design emerges from the text of a book. Just as the words on the pages of your favorite novel come alive in your imagination, so our products are designed to illustrate the memorable characters and scenes rooted in these words. We work closely with top artists to create a new visual experience for classic and contemporary works alike.
From a distance, the artwork on our t-shirts, posters, totes – and now scarves – illustrates a theme, character, or setting from each book. Move closer and the text becomes fully legible!
Find our full collection at litographs.com – we've been making art from books since 2011.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been printing text on clothing and accessories for 4 years, making improvements in quality each and every year. While this is our first time producing infinity scarves at scale, we're working with the same process and with the same team who have produced hundreds of thousands of hand-pressed Litographs t-shirts for book lovers all over the world.

If we achieve our goal, we guarantee that you will receive a product you love.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Just in time for the holidays, we're excited to make custom scarves available to purchase on Litographs.com.
https://www.litographs.com/products/custom-scarf
If you were not able to submit your survey before it closed, you can now redeem your custom reward on Litographs.com using the codes we emailed you last month. If you have any questions, please email Litographs support and we'll always get back to you in less than 24 hours (often within 1-2 hours!).

It's finally scarf weather, and we're excited to have launched our first set of literary scarves on Litographs.com. Thank you for helping us reach this milestone! We will be adding to our collection over the next few weeks, and by the beginning of November we expect to have over 200 titles available, as well as an option for custom text.
If you were not able to submit your survey before it closed last month, you should have received an email yesterday with instructions for redeeming your reward on Litographs.com. If you have any questions, please email Litographs support and we'll always get back to you in less than 24 hours (often within 1-2 hours!). 
We learned a lot printing and shipping our first batches of scarves this summer, and it's been so much fun to see photos and reviews coming in. I've attached a few below - please keep them coming!

Thank you for helping to make custom Litographs a reality! Now that the campaign is over (and we're recovered from an awesome BookCon), we'll be getting in touch with a survey for you to fill out. 
In the survey, you'll let us know the details for your reward and will have an opportunity to submit custom text. We know that your text might be in a non-standard format, so we'll be available to provide one-on-one support wherever needed. We'll also include more information about reward options and detailed instructions for text submissions.

We’re truly humbled by the incredible response to our new custom products. Your support and creativity are what enable us to keep pushing forward.
We can’t wait to see the many diverse texts you choose to wear and share with your friends and family – let us know your best ideas in the comments!
- Danny

campaign.story:
Official Site | Facebook | Twitter | Vine | G+ | YouTube | Tumblr | Insta | Ideas | Donate
TIME CHASERS riffed LIVE in a movie theater near you! -> TICKETS
ATTEND RIFFTRAX LIVE: TIME CHASERS IN PERSON May 5th! CLICK HERE!
MST3K Reunion tickets go on sale April 15th!
Are you in?
Thank you for helping us exceed our monetary goal! You asked for even more stretch goals, so we have delivered for you below. They're not about money, but about getting MORE backers, and spreading news of the MST3K Reunion far and wide. Tell your friends to back us at ANY level - even $1 - and they'll get a TON of free stuff including 11 shorts and a bunch of RiffTrax MP3s. For FREE!
It's happening, thanks to YOU!
Yes, a Mystery Science Theater 3000 reunion broadcast to hundreds of movie theaters all across America is happening on June 28th. For this, our 20th live show celebrating our 10th year of making movies funny, we're busy planning an amazing night of riffing and comedy with most of the original MST3K stars, including...
RiffTrax regulars Michael J. Nelson, Kevin Murphy, Bill Corbett!
PLUS confirmed special guest riffers:
Trace Beaulieu, Frank Conniff, Mary Jo Pehl and Bridget Nelson, Jonah Ray and Joel Hodgson!
RiffTrax Live: MST3K Reunion
Thanks to our generous backers, the MST3K Reunion show WILL take place on Tuesday, June 28th, 2016 in Minneapolis, MN - the birthplace of Mystery Science Theater 3000!
RiffTrax Live: TIME CHASERS on May 5th!
The base goal for the Kickstarter is helping us fund ANOTHER super-cool event -- a RiffTrax Live show featuring an all-new riff on the best science-fiction film to come out of Vermont, TIME CHASERS! We've already secured the rights to this MST3K classic, and thanks to your generous donations, we've created a new widescreen HD transfer of the original movie in partnership with the film's creator, David Giancola.
RiffTrax Live: Time Chasers
To fund this once-in-a-lifetime piece of MSTie History, we need your help. The cost to pull it off is beyond doing on our own, but with a little help from our fans, we can make it happen. In exchange, we've come up with some exciting rewards and VIP packages just for you. Since we met our base goal, that means 2 ADDITIONAL shows have been unlocked for 2016. Woohoo! We're still trying to figure out what those titles are, and are actively talking to potential movie partners right this very moment.
So friends, please join us (won't you?) for this hilarious adventure: the MST3K REUNION SHOW broadcast LIVE to hundreds of movie screens on June 28th; TIME CHASERS on May 5th, and two more potential shows later in 2016. With your help, this year could be the biggest one yet!
WHAT'S THE REUNION SHOW GOING TO BE LIKE?
The MST3K Reunion Show will be a night to remember:  A cavalcade of goofy educational short films like the ones often riffed on the show, and that we continue to riff over at RiffTrax. Our old colleagues from MST3K will each join us on stage to joke around and riff a short or two. We may not have the puppets or costumes, but we will have a blast.
There'll be a ton of funny stuff which we're still figuring out, but we know for sure you'll get a night of amazing and hilarious shorts riffed of course by our own - Mike, Kevin and Bill. Bridget and Mary Jo, who have been a big hit on RiffTrax, will team up; Frank and Trace will dazzle you with their awesome comedic talents, and Jonah Ray and Joel Hodgson round out the cast as they riff a short together.
Then, prepare yourselves for the grand finale: a SUPER RIFF-A-PALOOZA with all the guests at once!
The whole thing will be filmed live in front of a big crowd at the State Theater in downtown Minneapolis, and simulcast to 700+ theaters all across the U.S. (and, if possible, Canada!). Then MST3K fans all across North America will meet up in theaters to enjoy the show! 
We'll also sponsor a cosplay contest, with winners to be announced live during the show that very night!
WHO WE ARE
The guys at RIFFTRAX have been providing hilarious movie commentary for years. First as writers and stars of the cult TV comedy show MYSTERY SCIENCE THEATER 3000  – and then online since 2006, as RIFFTRAX – Michael J. Nelson, Kevin Murphy and Bill Corbett have taken on movies bad and not-so-bad, with one and only one mission: to make them funny.
RiffTrax has written and performed comic riffs for over 400 titles that range from major Hollywood blockbusters, to obscure B-movies and educational short films. We've even been on TV on the National Geographic Channel, riffing zany animal shows. You also might have caught us on Comedy Central's @midnight last June. Oh, you did? Well then POINTS!!! And that's not all - we just recently announced an amazing new RiffTrax app that magically syncs our Riffs to the biggest blockbuster movies!
Celebrity guests on various RiffTrax offerings have included Neil Patrick Harris, "Weird Al" Yankovic, Bob Odenkirk, David Cross, Paul F. Tompkins, Joel McHale, Jonathan Coulton, Andy Richter, Kristen Schaal, John Hodgman, Mythbuster Adam Savage, Maria Bamford, Chris Hardwick, Fred Willard, NPR's Peter Sagal and loads more.
If you're still not familiar with us, check out this video for a little taste of what we do at RiffTrax:
WHY WE'RE ON KICKSTARTER
In 2009 we did an experiment: a live show in Nashville, riffing the Ed Wood classic PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE, simulcast to 500 movie theaters around the U.S.A. It was a raging success, and RiffTrax Live was born. Since then, we've done 17 more live simulcast shows, including: "MANOS" THE HANDS OF FATE; the sorpnl-filled D-movie BIRDEMIC; the bug-infested classic STARSHIP TROOPERS; Vincent Price's cheesy HOUSE ON HAUNTED HILL, the SyFy sensation SHARKNADO and many more, most of which were only made possible thanks to the generous support of you, the Kickstarter community.
Movie rights and film remastering expenses cost a decent chunk of change, and the production costs for the Live Shows themselves are crazy high, especially doing a show from downtown Minneapolis - so to have this madness make any economic sense we need your help. We have our deal with Fathom Events locked in, we have the dates reserved for the shows, and we have a bunch of stars from MST3K on board for a night of hilarious entertainment - the rest is up to you! 
WHAT DO YOU GET OUT OF THIS DEAL?
Lots of stuff! For starters, every backer at every level gets first dibs on tickets to see the live shows in person - including the MST Reunion show, which is sure to sell out. That's an EXCLUSIVE advance purchasing window just for backing us on Kickstarter!
Please take a look at the rewards we've created, listed here on this page. Unfortunately, due to the complexities of the many individual movie theaters, we are unable to give away actual theater tickets to the shows as rewards.
But we CAN give you the actual digital downloads of two of them: the MST REUNION SHOW and TIME CHASERS, along with the other exclusive rewards created just for backers. That, plus the warm fuzzy feeling of knowing you helped make an MST Reunion possible.
We're offering great rewards at very low-priced levels, as well as some fantastic VIP packages that include meeting the MST gang in Minneapolis, tickets for the best seats in the house, getting your picture in the credits, and even being able to write a riff that will be used in a Live Show script!
Wondering what goes on at our VIP meet-and-greets? Check out this video from our STARSHIP TROOPERS gathering:
WHAT IF WE GET EXTRA MONEY, PAST OUR GOAL?
We raised past our goal in our last three Kickstarter projects, and all of the money collected went towards getting the rights to the movies (plus getting additional movies to riff live), top notch production of the event itself, and in creating and fulfilling rewards. It will be no different this time around.
Making these shows a reality costs meaningfully more than our base goal, and so if we raise more money, it will go towards movie acquisition costs for two more shows this year, better production values, and towards all the awesome rewards.  And perhaps you know that since RiffTrax started offering Mystery Science Theater 3000 episodes, we have been giving a portion of sales to all the MST principal cast members. RiffTrax will put a meaningful portion of all additional proceeds beyond our Kickstarter goal into this same pool.  
With all that being said... THANK YOU! We have the best fans in the world, and we know how lucky we are. This summer marks our 10th birthday at RiffTrax - we couldn't have done it without our fans, and we sincerely thank you for your support over these many years. We can't wait to make you laugh even more during 2016 - so join us for RiffTrax Live!
March 29: Exclusive Backer shirt revealed!
Take a look at the first draft of the concept for the EXCLUSIVE backer shirt available to backers pledging for the $100 reward and higher:
Some details subject to change
Who do you recognize? Who would YOU like to see? Let us know in the comments of Update #9!
STRETCH GOALS!
We realize there are lot of Kickstarter-ers who are discovering RiffTrax thanks to the #BringBackMST3K campaign, and we're thrilled to have you on board. So we thought it'd be fun to give away 11 of our most-loved shorts, including perennial favorites "Safety Woman", "What is Nothing?" and "This is Hormel" plus a few others we've carefully hand-selected from our catalog, including the mind-bending classroom-setting-up film "Setting Up a Room". More information in Update #6!
IF WE REACH.. YOU'LL GET: 
3,600 backers – Safety Woman: In Danger Out of Doors (UNLOCKED!)
3,700 backers – Love That Car! (UNLOCKED!)
3,800 backers – What is Nothing? (UNLOCKED!)
3,900 backers – Flying Saucer Mystery (UNLOCKED!)
4,000 backers – Life in the Suburbs (UNLOCKED!)
4,100 backers – Maintaining Classroom Discipline (UNLOCKED!)
4,200 backers – This is Hormel  (UNLOCKED!)
4,300 backers – The Creeps Machine (UNLOCKED!)
4,400 backers – Danger: Keep Out (UNLOCKED!)
4,500 backers – Story-telling: Can You Tell it in Order? (UNLOCKED!)
4,600 backers – Setting Up a Room (UNLOCKED!)
And we recently announced more stretch rewards as shown in the graphic at the top of the page!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge to this Kickstarter is that we are unable to do the most obvious thing: pre-sell actual movie theater tickets to all the live shows. The reason for this is that we can't control which theaters will pick up the show, and on top of the fact that they all use different systems, the logistics of pre-selling tickets to all the various theater chains is pretty much impossible.

But we ARE able to offer digital versions of at least TWO of the shows - the MST3K Reunion Show and TIME CHASERS - as rewards, along with the other fun rewards available at all levels.

In the end, all we want to do is provide you with some great laugh-out-loud evenings, this year going even bigger than before. Thanks for being part of MST and RiffTrax history!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
THE LAST TIME WE WERE HERE, an intimate new folk rock musical, transports us to a world of dimly lit bars in which a single moment can be transformed into a lingering memory by no more than a guitar and a mic. Jacob, a singer-songwriter on a path toward superstardom, struggles to make sense of the big moments in his life – most notably the end of his relationship with Grace, a passionate woman fascinated by a romance from the past. Two other performers weave the stories of other couples into this powerful blend of music, love letters and poetry that catapults us across time and out of our contemporary world of snapchats and shortcuts onto a journey of two hearts aching to be heard in a world too small for their words.
Jeremiah & Jessica met auditioning around town in Atlanta. Jeremiah had been working on a musical for close to 7 years. When Jessica offered to give the script "a look," she was immediately swept up in Jeremiah's unique songwriting, and that look very quickly turned into a dynamic partnership. They realized they had a story to tell. The two began furiously working to totally re-design and re-create the script and bring the songs to a place where they felt comfortable sharing what they'd made with their community. With the addition of new songs, new words and new voices, THE LAST TIME WE WERE HERE was born. After 2 very successful concert performances, a sold-out staged reading at Actor's Express, and the encouragement of their peers, they realized their show had a special kind of magic-and the team began to feel that it was ready for a wider audience. 
Some audience feedback:
"It's amazing and ridiculously relate-able. The perfect mix of comedy, quirkiness and sadness. The perfect love story."
"You inspired me. More than you'll ever know."
"Very genuine, heart-felt and thoughtful."
"Totally raw. I was with you the whole way. Brought up so many memories and emotions. Thanks for being REAL. Seriously."
"Humorous, honest and genuine."
"Two words that come to mind: Raw. Passion."
THE LAST TIME WE WERE HERE was selected to perform in New York City for lots of important people. 
But, just like any upstart, rag-tag, underdog project, we need a little help from our friends.
Check out one of our favorite cuts and give us a listen, #TLTWWH
 Want more clips? Click here to visit our YouTube Channel and here to check us out on soundcloud.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are full time artists in Atlanta and simply do not have the expendable funds to make this journey on our own. However, saying no to this opportunity is not an option for us and we are dedicated to representing our community and our story in NY. We've made our deposit and there's no turning back! We have a generous network of support in NY that will take care of us in any number of tremendously valuable ways-we just need a nudge (or a shove) to get us up there. 

So YOU know, here is what your donation goes to fund:

Remaining Registration/Venue rental fees for NYMF
Airfare/Transportation
Room and Board
Stage Manager
Lighting Designer
Sound Technician
Microphone and other Equipment Fees
A "stocked" portable Bar for our set
3 bar stools
Insurance to cover all artists/technicians/staff/equipment in the venue during our tech and performances
Logo Design
Video/Editing
Photographer
Costuming
Our ad in the NYMF program for 2015
Design/Printing/Mailing of Postcards
Design/Printing of Programs
Materials and Packaging of Media Pack (photos, print materials, CD)
Hiring of Load In and Load Out staff for the Festival wide Load-in/Load out
Other Advertising Costs (it's obviously so important for all the fancy people to see our show, so the story can continue!)

In the meantime, thank you for coming with us this far, now come along for the rest of the way.

#TLTWWH

campaign.story:
Reach goal
Thanks to all our wonderful backers, we've broken our goal in less than 10 days! You're incredible.
Let's keep that going: Our reach goal is $30,000. We'll use that money to pay our writers even better and fund our operations into 2016. Every dollar you pledge will be spent publishing the best Southern journalism. And every subscription is another voice in the conversation.
So join us. Help us pay our writers well, build a vibrant readership, and fund Scalawag deep into 2016.
What we’re about
Scalawag is a new magazine and website focused on the American South. We're dedicated to real stories, good ideas, and the hard work of building a freer and more just future for our region. 
Four times a year, we’ll publish a beautiful print magazine filled with top-notch writing: long-form journalism, incisive commentary, and personal stories. In between issues, we’ll publish more great content online and host events to continue these conversations in person. We’ll examine and celebrate Southern ways of living together—personal and political. And unlike many publications, we won’t shy away from hard truths and controversy. 
We’re printing our first issue at the end of this month, and we couldn’t be more excited to share it with you. We had reporters on the front lines of protests in Atlanta, overturning archives to uncover the legacy of Jim Crow in North Carolina, and tracking down an elusive folk artist in New Orleans. Our contributors have collectively written a dozen books, and have been published everywhere from academic journals to The New York Times and The Atlantic. 
Your Kickstarter pledge will get Scalawag going, and help us run the magazine for this full year: four issues, online content, and soon events in communities around the South. We won’t stop there. Right now, we need your backing to get going.
Where we’re coming from
The fact is, there’s a shortage of good journalism in the South. Local newspapers are drying up, and Northern media can’t fill the gap. We're also short on thoughtful commentary, and on forthright civic conversation. These shortages couldn’t come at a worse time. There’s been a lot of hard news down South lately: too many children going hungry, too many folks out of a job, too many sick and too many in need. But there’s also hope and excitement. People across the across the region are doing incredible work to shape the futures of their communities.  
Amidst all of this, we need a way to know what’s going on, and a community in which to discuss it. That’s why we’re building Scalawag.
Scalawag will publish the South’s most necessary journalism, its very best ideas, and its most important stories. We’ll talk about the South without resorting to stereotypes. We’ll export good writing and sometimes import foreign perspectives. We’ll look for new ways of understanding the South in the fullness of its diversity and complexity. And we'll search for a full sense of what it is to be Southern in the twenty-first century. 
A draft of a spread from our first issue
We're laying out our first issue now, and already have pieces lined up for our second (and for the website). Our contributors are already working on all kinds of important stories – about lives of homeless men in a fast-growing city, good ideas on immigration in Mississippi, and queer communities across the rural South. We' want to approach the familiar and the new with an open heart as we listen and share the stories that are shaping the South.
Who we are
Our team
We’re a team of young Southerners – from Virginia down to the Mississippi Delta – with a carpetbagger thrown in for good measure. Among us we’ve got important experience: teaching writing and journalism, leading state-wide field operations for the Obama campaign, consulting for the United Nations and top CEOs—even winning a Rhodes Scholarship.
We know we have a lot left to learn. That’s why we’re so glad to have a community of advisors at our back. At the center of this community is our Board of Advisors, full of experienced writers and journalists, like Alec MacGillis, Taylor Branch, Anne Fadiman, and Bill Chafe. They’ve won a stunning number of awards—including two Pulitzer prizes.
Of course lots of folks can recite nice resumes. So what’s more important is that our team shares a commitment to the future of the South, and to the conversations and communities that will shape that future. We care about the folks who share our homes here. And we’re genuinely curious about the questions Scalawag will ask and answer. 
Why we’re Kickstarting
The money you pledge on Kickstarter will jump start Scalawag’s first year. It’ll take Scalawag from a project in our kitchens to something real—it’ll let us pay our writers fairly, print our magazine, build out our website, and cover the costs of serious journalism. More than all that, your pledge will also be an investment in the magazine’s future. Scalawag may be a non-profit, but we don’t intend to rely on outside help forever. So we’ve built a real business model, and we intend to become sustainable within three years. Like y’all, Scalawag will be in this for the long haul.
What you’ll get
We’re most excited to (finally) be offering subscriptions to Scalawag’s first and second years. But pick your fancy: You can also get our signature cocktail recipe, a mason jar for drinking it, a limited-edition print of our first cover, or even a lifetime subscription.
Something else you want to know? 
Email us at editors@scalawagmag.org! We'd be happy to hear from you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We don’t want to pretend this will all be easy. Here’re three of the biggest challenges we face, and what we’re doing about them.

• We’re piloting an unconventional model in an uncertain time. The market for media is undergoing a generational shift. So we’ve focused on developing a real path to sustainability: keeping our operating costs low, and building a base of committed subscribers. Moreover, our 501c(3) status means we’ll never have to compromise our mission to stay in print.

• We need to build awareness to succeed. Scalawag has to reach readers, and these days people’s attention can be hard to come by. So we’ve been pushing to spread our message, testing the idea with hundreds of influential Southerners, and developing a comprehensive marketing plan.

• We need to attract top-notch contributors. Real journalism takes real talent. That’s why we're working nonstop to source pieces from some of the best journalists in the country. Our success to date gives us confidence we can succeed. 

Above all, we’re committed to this project for the long haul. We know the path forward isn't simple. But we'll continue to ask the questions the South most needs discussed. We can get only get started with your backing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Attention + Activism = Scalalove (and the Milestone Campaign)
updates.update_content:
Y'all,
Almost every time I’ve met someone new to Scalawag, they always ask how I became Scalawag's (now former) carpetbagger-in-residence. There's an important part of that story that I didn't talk about for a long time.
When I was 18, I was diagnosed with advanced non-Hodgkin lymphoma. Instead of starting my second semester at college, I began six months of chemo, followed by six weeks of radiation. I passed a lot of that time reading and watching the news. At the beginning of my treatment, it often felt like the only news was the debate over Obamacare. And when I'd look away from the coverage coming from Washington—would there be a public option? would the bill even pass?—I saw my fellow patients.

Today is the three year anniversary of when we launched this Kickstarter campaign. During that campaign, 374 of you pledged $31,548 to support our mission to reckon with the South. I repeat those numbers a lot—they're burned in my memory because to me, they represent the trust y'all have placed in us.
And we're even celebrating one more milestone: Yesterday I signed off on our proofs for Scalawag Issue 12—Spring 2018. It's the last issue of our third year publishing.

It's been one year since our Kickstarter campaign wrapped up—and it's been quite a year. We've published stories from across the South, sharing reporting and essays from writers who've dug into family history and hidden policy papers, the meaning of mental illness and the fight against climate change.
We still believe in fostering a Southern conversation—an inclusive conversation full of the many different voices that shape our homes.

Our fellow Scalawags,
It's over: In thirty days, thanks to 374 of you, Scalawag broke its Kickstarter goal by more than $10,000. We've now raised enough money to push into 2016, and to ensure that we can pay our writers. You'll always be able to see our video and story here on this Kickstarter page. And you can always follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
Soon enough, our real website will be live with great Southern journalism, commentary, and more. So stay tuned to . And, for those of you got a first issue or a subscription — check your real live mailbox. We can't wait to share this beautiful magazine with you. And we're thrilled to have y'all backing us as Scalawag launches.

Backers and fellow Scalawags,
We've got today and three more days left—and we're on the verge of breaking our reach goal. It's all thanks to your awesome support. You've helped us build a remarkable foundation for Scalawag's future. We're going to be able to pay our writers well, publish a beautiful magazine for over a year, and so help to rebuild civic conversation in the South.
You all have come from all across the South (and country, and world)—folks working at foundations in Georgia and North Carolina, journalists from New York and New Orleans, our awesome friends, and so many of you whom we have yet to meet.

updates.update_userinfo: You're awesome: We broke the first goal--let's keep going
updates.update_content:
Friends and fellow scalawags,
Thanks to you, we've broken our initial goal in fewer than ten days! Thank you so much. We've been exhilarated by your enthusiasm, and we can't wait to put Scalawag in your hands.
Right now, we have about three weeks left on Kickstarter—and we want to use every hour. So we've set a reach goal of $30,000. Every extra dollar will fund the best long-form journalism in the South. The more we raise, the better we can pay our writers, the sooner we'll start producing video reporting and podcasts, and the faster we'll get Scalawag into hands and minds across the South.

Y'all are great! You've pledged more than half of our initial goal in our first two days—over $10,000! We're thrilled to have your support, and we're so honored by all your enthusiasm. Thanks for everything—your support, your kind words, and your commitment to building a better South.

campaign.story:
Suspension of Disbelief explores life in a town on the edge of constant and certain doom from Jane & John Q. Peasant’s point of view.
The story behind Suspension of Disbelief began when we started reminiscing about our LARPing days. Every month was filled with evil villains, horrible monsters and world-ending danger; which lead to the question: "Who the hell would want to live here?!"
Proof of Concept Pilot
 Proof of Concept: Fence of Summoning
The show started with a few sketches about the crazy things that happen in, really, any fantasy game as seen from the NPCs point-of-view.  We had a few generic townies standing in as our protagonists watching as people were assassinated in broad daylight, corrupted the basic fabric of reality and came up with the dumbest character names.  
After we held an open casting call, those protagonists really took shape.  We initially imagined four men in the roles, maybe gender-flipping one or two if we needed to.  Turns out, we had four phenomenal women blow us away at auditions.  They came in immediately harnessing the possibilities in these characters, breathing a real life into them.  After meeting those four women, there was no question.  Our Salvagers would be women.  And they would be hilarious.
We knew we had something special after the initial table read.  We filmed the shorts over a long weekend, building the exterior porch and interior of our own Last Chance Tavern.  As we edited the shorts, we began sketching out future adventures.  The story took a life of its own, growing into its own fleshed out fantasy world.  The more we saw of the work our cast had done, the more we knew that this show deserved more.  After much deliberation, we came to the conclusion that a few short sketches wasn’t going to be enough for these women, these characters or this new world we had discovered.  Taking what we had already filmed as a proof of concept and the centerpiece of the first season, we began rewriting in earnest, introducing more characters, more intrigue and more monsters for our special effects department to play with.
Season One is now a feature-length season told in seven episodes.  We follow the Salvagers as they try and survive: monster-summoning fences, rogue adventurers, sentient vegetation, visiting nobility, undead hordes, and totally harmless old men with ulterior motives. We couldn’t be prouder of this new show and we need your help to unleash it on an unsuspecting world!  BWAHAHAHA...sorry.
Find Us On Social Media:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SODSeries 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/sod_series
Tumblr: http://isthatblakeoutlaw.tumblr.com/
From the beginning we wanted to tell this story from a peasant's-eye view. We wanted to start off with a simple story of simple people trying to make a life under extraordinary circumstances.
Out of our first few sketches came the Salvagers. They don't hunt, they don't fight, they don't take sides, they stay out of politics and crazy adventures. The Salvagers pick up what's left behind on the battlefield when the Heroes are done fighting, either because they're victorious or they've fallen and their spirits are on their way to be resurrected. The Salvagers, or others like them, sell gear back to unlucky adventurers or to merchants in town at a reasonable mark-up.
 Dani is played by Madi York
Willa is played by Madeline Hatter
Sally is played by Adena Brumer 
 Myke is played by Christina Leidel
This is a world with a severe class distinction between Heroes and the rest of us. For Heroes life is easy, money is plentiful, power is assumed, and death is a minor inconvenience.
Being a hero in Arbrontith means weighing your options, following the directions of your Faction and kicking selective ass at a rate that would make a third-world dictator blush.  Being literally anyone else means running, hiding, swearing, scratching out whatever existence you can manage, running some more and definitely NOT farming.  It means turning a blind eye to random crimes and wanton slaughter in the streets.  It means only counting on heroes to do the bare minimum required to get some sweet loot while your home is invaded by goblins or burned by pillaging barbarian hordes.
Some heroes are assholes.  Ok, most heroes are assholes.  But some show up with the express purpose of robbing and killing their way to the top.  It always seems cool to wear all black and be the villain until you run face-first into an Abyssal Horror and find out what true Evil feels like.
Of course there are the monsters, too.  The Dark One summons them from the surrounding countryside, conjures them from the Hellmouth (did we mention there’s a Hellmouth?  That’s pretty hazardous to one’s health.) or finds ways to manipulate weaker minds into becoming his eternal Doom Slaves.  They arrive regularly, almost by some unseen schedule, fight heroes (even though instinct should tell them not to go near the place where untold thousands of their brethren have been massacred) and die horribly.  Some are truly terrible and dangerous.  Some, like our artistic goblin friend pictured above, are pretty stupid and relatively harmless.  Just watch out for what’s on his paintbrush.  It’s probably not poop.
 HeadGames Entertainment has been around since 2007. We've spent seven years making films, succeeding, failing, and learning from those failures. We have produced two full seasons of the hit webseries Star Command:
 We've worked with tons of special effects, huge casts, make-up, costumes and sets. We are used to the challenges involved with "genre fiction" while still finding the heart and humor buried within.
You can see from our photos and videos what we can do with no budget, imagine what we can do with your backing.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We Are Experienced
Filmmaking is inherently challenging, and every production has its ups and downs. HeadGames Entertainment has been making webseries and videos for eight years and we've dealt with problems from not having a camera to dealing with losing a cast member. We plan obsessively and schedule well in advance to prepare for difficult situations.

We Have Great People
Suspension of Disbelief requires a lot of sets, props and costumes. We have made everything from giant starships to alien planets on a limited budget and borrowed props and costumes. We have built an extensive network of people who are used to working with little or no budget. With this Kickstarter we have no doubt they will do amazing things with what they are given.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
